Dear Prof. Goodwin
I tried during these last days to find how files are converted 
into .xml file, because I think it is the key for solving my problem.
I am using a 6.5 Student version of Matlab.
Maybe I forget something during the installation of Cantera and 
that's why a changed cti file can't convert into an xml file.
Do you have any idea where this problem come from?
I apologise for bothering you with such easy question.

Thanks
Solene





--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "se_deferrieres" <De_Ferieres-
S@u...> wrote:
> Hello...
> I am trying to change the scheme of a H2/O2/Ar/N2, but I always 
get 
> this error:
> Procedure: ct2ctml
> Error:   could not convert input file to CTML
>  command line was: python C:\DOCUME~1\FireSERT\LOCALS~1
> \Temp/.cttmp1118422954.pyw> ct2ctml.log 2>&1
> 
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\ctmethods.dll
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\@XML_Node\XML_Node.m
> On line 11  ==>    x.id = ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml(name)
> 
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\@Solution\Solution.m
> On line 30  ==> doc = XML_Node('doc',src);
> 
> Error in ==> c:\cantera\matlab\toolbox\cantera\IdealGasMix.m
> On line 39  ==>        s = Solution(a);
> 
> Error in ==> 
> C:\Cantera\research\premixedflame\marinov\flameh2o2n2ar.m
> On line 43  ==> gas = IdealGasMix(rxnmech);
> 
> I have this error even with only one reaction and I can't find 
where 
> it came from.
> 
> help would be greatly appreciated!
> Solene
